intro: Rhynchospora setigera, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or reddish in color. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in swampy habitats. Rhynchospora setigera plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
